title: Hannover goalkeeper Ron-Robert Zieler sent off after punching striker in testicles in Bundesliga 2
text:
Former Manchester United goalkeeper and World Cup winner Ron-Robert Zieler may not want to remember his Bundesliga 2 exploits with current club Hannover on Saturday in a hurry.

The experienced keeper, who returned to the club where he has punched the most balls of his career during the summer, reacted frustratedly to a 95th-minute equaliser at the end of a thrilling 3-3 draw for Hannover at Karlsruher.

Swinging his fist at the ball as it bounced back across the penalty area following the late leveller, Zieler accidentally caught goalscorer Daniel Gordon in a sensitive area, sending the defender writhing across the byline.

Hannover keeper Ron-Robert Zieler was sent off after catching an opponent in a painful blow

The former Manchester United and Leicester stopper sent Daniel Gordon crashing to the floor

As Gordon collapsed to the ground, Zieler, who had already conceded a penalty, seen Gordon score the first of his two goals and watched Hannover go ahead twice, received his marching orders for a second yellow card.

Hannover had used of all their substitutes, forcing coach Mirko Slomka to put defender Josip Elez in goal for the final seconds of a frantic ending to a match in which they had taken a 93rd-minute lead through German forward Hendrik Weydandt.

Elez did not have to make a save as Hannover stretched their unbeaten away run to three matches, although they missed out on a win that would have taken them to fifth in the table and will be without the banned Zieler for a game.

Jan Schlaudraff, Hannover's Sporting Director, described the match as 'pure spectacle'. 'Of course, the yellow-red card against Ron is unfortunate,' he added.

'He actually wants to hit the ball out of frustration and then does not hit the ball, but the opponent. That's a yellow card and therefore a red.'

Zieler was offered his first professional contract by Sir Alex Ferguson at Old Trafford in 2008

Keeper Zieler (second from left) was part of the Germany squad that won the 2014 World Cup

Hannover will miss the experience of a player who has made more than 200 appearances for the club, having begun his career in Manchester United's youth setup between 2005 and 2008.

Zieler signed professional forms with then-United manager Sir Alex Ferguson at the end of his apprenticeship, but never made an appearance for the club's senior side.

The 30-year-old, who was part of Germany's World Cup-winning squad in 2014, spent time on loan at Northampton Town - nicknamed the Cobblers - during the 2008-09 season.

He returned to Hannover in 2010, becoming a domestic regular and acting as an understudy for Germany during their World Cup triumph in Brazil in 2014, adding football's most prestigious trophy to his six international caps.

Zieler returned to the United Kingdom in 2016 when he joined Leicester City for a season

He made nine appearances for Leicester after returning to England for the 2016-17 season, then joined Stuttgart for two seasons before switching back to Hannover.

Schlaudraff said the performance of man in the middle Guido Winkmann had given Hannover 'nothing to complain about'.

Winkmann, who is an experienced referee across Germany's professional divisions, last produced a dismissal in even more dramatic circumstances.

He showed Bayern Munich's Niklas Sule a straight red card during the champions' 5-4 home win in front of 75,000 people at the Allianz Arena in the quarter-finals of the DFB-Pokal cup competition in April.

Zieler also won the European Under-19 Championship with Germany in 2008 but has not appeared for his country since 2015.
description: The former Manchester United and Leicester goalkeeper accidentally caught goalscorer Daniel Gordon in a painful area during the Bundesliga 2 match, earning a red card for his low blow.
